Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: PERIOD_ID: unique identifier for the production period.
Column Comment.3: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.4: VOLUME METHOD: The type of method used to determine the volume of flu idsmoved. Examples would be measured, prorated, engineering study, e tc.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVITY TYPE: The type of activity that caused the movement of fluids to occursuch as production, injection, flaring, sales, etc.
Column Comment.6: PERIOD TYPE: A reference table identifying the length of time for which a volume isrecorded. Possible values are DAY, MONTH, YEAR.
Column Comment.7: AMENDMENT SEQUENCE NUMBER: used to order amendment events forproduction volumes. For each PDEN, volume method, acitivity type, period type andvolume date, the first row is 0. Subsequent rows are sequenced by 1, so that the fullamendment history may be recreated. When supporting amendments, rows areusually not editable once entered. Instead, new rows are created that track theamended record.
Column Comment.8: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.9: PDEN AMENDMENT REASON: The reason why a production amendment wasposted, such as instrument calibration, calculation error or volume balancing.
Column Comment.10: BOE CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume for a production entityexpressed as Barrels of Oil Equivalent (BOE). This is usually captured as the closingvolume for the period (not normally the opening volume)
Column Comment.11: BOE VOLUME: The total volume for the reporting period expressed as Barrels of OilEquivalent (BOE).
Column Comment.12: BOE VOLUME OUOM: Barrels of oil equivalent original unit of measure.
Column Comment.13: BOE YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total volume year to date for a production entityexpressed as Barrels of Oil Equivalent (BOE).
Column Comment.14: CO2 CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume of CO2 for a production entity.This is usually captured as the closing volume for the period (not normally theopening volume)
Column Comment.15: CO2 VOLUME: The CO2 volume for the reporting period.
Column Comment.16: CO2 VOLUME OUOM: CO2 volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: CO2 YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total CO2 volume year to date for a productionentity.
Column Comment.18: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.19: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.20: GAS CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume of gas for a production entity.This is usually captured as the closing volume for the period (not normally theopening volume)
Column Comment.21: GAS ENERGY: The amount of gas energy produced.
Column Comment.22: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE for this row of data
Column Comment.23: GAS QUALITY: Value for the thermal quality of gas reported. This is often recordedin British Thermal Units (BTUs) and can be used to calculate the Barrel of OilEquivalent (BOE).
Column Comment.24: GAS QUALITY OUOM: Gas quality original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: GAS VOLUME: The gas volume for the reporting period.
Column Comment.26: GAS VOLUME OUOM: Gas volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: GAS YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total gas volume year to date for a productionentity.
Column Comment.28: INJECTION CYCLE: A sequential number assigned to each cycle phase of injectionwhich permits the tracking of cyclic injection used in tertiary projects. Regularinjection such as found in waterflood projects are recorded as cycle number zero.Only those projects which are in a cycle of alternating injection substances or in acycle of injection and then production will be assigned a number other than zero.
Column Comment.29: INJECTION PRESSURE: The pressure, measured at surface, that was used to injectone or more fluids. This is often measured as well head pressure.
Column Comment.31: INVENTORY OPENING BALANCE: The opening balance of the inventory product.
Column Comment.32: INVENTORY OPENING BALANCE: The opening balance of the inventory product.
Column Comment.33: INVENTORY PRODUCT: The product for which the inventory values are made.
Column Comment.34: INVENTORY CLOSING BALANCE OUOM: Inventory closing balance original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.35: INVENTORY OPENING BALANCE OUOM: Inventory opening balance original unitof measure.
Column Comment.36: NGL CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume of NGL for a production entity.This is usually captured as the closing volume for the period (not normally theopening volume)
Column Comment.37: NGL VOLUME: The ngl volume for the reporting period.
Column Comment.38: NGL VOLUME OUOM: NGL volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.39: NGL YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total ngl volume year to date for a productionentity.
Column Comment.40: NITROGEN CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume of nitrogen for aproduction entity. This is usually captured as the closing volume for the period (notnormally the opening volume)
Column Comment.41: NITROGEN VOLUME: The nitrogen volume for the reporting period.
Column Comment.42: NITROGEN VOLUME OUOM: Nitrogen volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.43: NITROGEN YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total nitrogen volume year to date for aproduction entity.
Column Comment.44: NUMBER OF GAS WELLS: The number of gas wells that are associated with thisentity for production reporting purposes.
Column Comment.45: NUMBER OF INJECTION WELLS: The number of injection wells that are associatedwith this entity for production reporting purposes.
Column Comment.46: NUMBER OF OIL WELLS: The number of oil wells that are associated with this entityfor production reporting purposes.
Column Comment.47: OIL CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume of oil for a production entity.This is usually captured as the closing volume for the period (not normally theopening volume)
Column Comment.48: OIL QUALITY: Value for the thermal quality of oil reported. This is often recorded inBritish Thermal Units (BTUs) and can be used to calculate the Barrel of OilEquivalent (BOE).
Column Comment.49: OIL QUALITY OUOM: Oil quality original unit of measure.
Column Comment.50: OIL VOLUME: The oil volume for the reporting period.
Column Comment.51: OIL VOLUME OUOM: Oil volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.52: OIL YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total oil volume year to date for a productionentity.
Column Comment.53: PERIOD ON INJECTION: The period/time that fluids were injected during the currentreporting period.
Column Comment.54: PERIOD ON INJECTION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.55: PERIOD ON PRODUCTION: The period/ time that fluids were produced during thecurrent reporting period.
Column Comment.56: PERIOD ON PRODUCTION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.57: POSTED DATE: The date that this volume was posted, not necessarily the samedate as the volume is loaded into the database. This date is used to determine whennew volumes, such as amendments, were added to the database.
Column Comment.58: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.59: PRIMARY ALLOWABLE: The primary production rate of oil or gas a production entityis permitted to produce under proration orders of a regulatory body.
Column Comment.60: PRIMARY ALLOWABLE OUOM: Primary allowable original unit of measure.
Column Comment.61: PRIMARY PRODUCT: The primary product produced by this PDEN
Column Comment.62: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a project that resulted in the creation ofthese volumes, as in volume estimates created during a reserves projection analysisthat must be associated with the evaluation study that are their source. Alternatively,can use the association between PROJECT and PDEN in PROJECT COMPONENTin the event that a more general association will work.
Column Comment.63: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.64: REPORT IND: A Y/N flag added to allow users to keep track of rows that should beincluded in reporting.
Column Comment.65: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.66: SULPHUR CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume of sulphur for aproduction entity. This is usually captured as the closing volume for the period (notnormally the opening volume)
Column Comment.67: SULPHUR VOLUME: The sulphur volume for the reporting period.
Column Comment.68: SULPHUR VOLUME OUOM: Sulphur volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.69: SULPHUR YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total sulphur volume year to date for aproduction entity.
Column Comment.70: VOLUME DATE: The effective or reporting date of this volume summary.
Column Comment.71: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.72: VOLUME PERIOD: The duration over which a movement of fluid between twoproduction entities took place.
Column Comment.73: VOLUME PERIOD OUOM: Volume period original unit of measure.
Column Comment.74: WATER CUMULATIVE VOLUME: The cumulative volume of water for a productionentity. This is usually captured as the closing volume for the period (not normally theopening volume)
Column Comment.75: WATER VOLUME: The water volume for the reporting period.
Column Comment.76: WATER VOLUME OUOM: Water volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.77: WATER YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: The total water volume year to date for aproduction entity.
Column Comment.78: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.79: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.80: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.81: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.82: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.83: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.84: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
